page.title: 19A New Oil Pipeline
page.content:
Southampton to Wolverhampton
Part of this pipeline is running through this block.Firstly a swathe 20 yards wide is cut through all agricultural ground and fenced,apart from the underwater crossing of the river where steel sheet piles are driven into the river bed to allow the pipes to sink between.The steel pipes are laid on top of the ground and welded together in long sections.Each joint is X-rayed before being sunk into the ground.Land drains are laid simultaneously top and bottom.The ground is then re-instated to its original environment and compensation paid to the farmers. The cost of this pipeline is half a million pounds per mile paid for by the Oil Company.
